qas.question: How were the Portuguese expelled from Myanmar?

answers.text: The dynasty regrouped and defeated the Portuguese

qas.question: Did the country have lasting monarchs?

answers.text: Toungoo kings created a legal and political framework whose basic features would continue well into the 19th century

qas.question: Did the original chieftains maintain power political power?

answers.text: The crown completely replaced the hereditary chieftainships with appointed governorships in the entire Irrawaddy valley

qas.question: In what year was one of the original Myanmar kingdoms restored?

answers.text: In 1740, the Mon of Lower Myanmar founded the Restored Hanthawaddy Kingdom

context: <a0_0>The dynasty regrouped and defeated the Portuguese<a0_0/> in 1613 and Siam in 1614. It restored a smaller, more manageable kingdom, encompassing Lower Myanmar, Upper Myanmar, Shan states, Lan Na and upper Tenasserim. The Restored <a1_0>Toungoo kings created a legal and political framework whose basic features would continue well into the 19th century<a1_0/>. <a2_0>The crown completely replaced the hereditary chieftainships with appointed governorships in the entire Irrawaddy valley<a2_0/>, and greatly reduced the hereditary rights of Shan chiefs. Its trade and secular administrative reforms built a prosperous economy for more than 80 years. From the 1720s onward, the kingdom was beset with repeated Meithei raids into Upper Myanmar and a nagging rebellion in Lan Na. <a3_0>In 1740, the Mon of Lower Myanmar founded the Restored Hanthawaddy Kingdom<a3_0/>. Hanthawaddy forces sacked Ava in 1752, ending the 266-year-old Toungoo Dynasty.
